dialogues.Glass: Yep. Bridger'll take the tail, and Pig you haul the rest.            The Missouri's no good. Not if the `Ree's running it.  We get ourselves safe outta range, then track another course up.  No posts that far out.  You'd have done the same for me.  Middle of workin' on it.  Best I can tell, my place is right where I want it... on the smart end of my rifle.  Never like closin' my eyes when I'm not sure who'll be standin' over me when I open `em.  The tracks I saw... those `Ree had been tailin' us for a while. They'd have gone as far north as it took. You're a good man, Captain. Soon as you realize that, these others will too. 13.  Enough to try and stay outta their way.  I been here a long while. Whether that gets us to Union or not...  He wasn't wrong. Truth is that's what I prefer about this country... it's got no eye for the color of a man's skin.                    21.  23.                               stretched tight. Glass, naked, on his stomach at the center of the tee-pee, his arms and legs outstretched, secured to wooden stakes in the ground. The white worms cover his back. The Medicine Man... CHANTING... waving burning sticks in the air. A THICK LIQUID BOILING IN A POT... the Medicine Man's twisted hand reaching a gourd container in... filling it with the steaming mixture. The liquid POURING OVER GLASS' BACK. GLASS' FACE... arched to the sky... twisted in horrible pain. He SCREAMS THAT HORRIBLE GROWLING CRY. MORE IMAGES... even faster... the CHANTING more frantic... A SIOUX WOMAN,, staring down. HANDS wiping a GREEN SLUDGE over Glass' neck... chest. The Medicine Man dancing... chanting... shaking sticks lined with RATTLESNAKE TAILS. The moonlight shining through the tee-pee, illuminating the images of the buffalo and dancing shapes. Waki gently pouring fluid into Glass' mouth. The Medicine Man holding the SEVERED HEAD OF A SNAKE... lightly sinking the fangs around the wounds on Glass' throat. GLASS' EYES... wide open... rolling up white into his head. Thank you for what you done for me... stitchin' me back together... givin' me a chance.    You told me once that other men didn't think like him. But the truth is, most do. I seen it my whole life... the looks folks give... the whisperin'. I watched my wife and son die from the fever on accounta no white doctor would care for `em. Wasn't no different to them than if their neighbor's dog was sick. So I don't figure nobody's gonna care much that Fitzgerald took some dyin' nigger's rifle, and left him in the middle of nowhere.  Do you, Captain?  I thank you for the coffee. 88.  I'll make my way down river. See what turns up.  If I run across the boy, I'll send him back your way.  Where're you headed?  I can do this on my own.  Ice tore it up. 93.  If the snow holds off, we'll have a good trail to track.  And the Missouri. Doubt he'd risk the river with the `Ree. Likely grab a horse, and cross over high... take his chances goin' east against the weather. When'd you say he skipped out?  We best pick up our pace.  Couple nights back. But these tracks aren't all his.   Came in after. Prints are smooth. Mocassins.  Could be Sioux... Blackfoot even.  I don't figure nothin', Captain. But whoever it is, they're a good day behind Fitzgerald.  And they're on his trail too, so we should keep it quiet... don't announce we're back here.  I do.  You're welcome to head back, Captain. dialogues.Fitzgerald: Likely got a splinter. Can't figure what to do without Mama here to pull it out for him. 2.   Shame my Pap was a broken down drunk. Else he could've bought me a Captain's job too.  We got a plan for these fires, Captain, or are we roastin' berries all the way up to Fort Union?  My supper's in the hands of a hermit nigger, a kid and a dummy. Hell, my belly feels full already.  What's the plan, Captain?  Captain! What the hell do we do now?  So we just float the hell down to Mexico or wherever else this river takes us?  Add weeks to the trip.   Shut up, kid, you don't get no say in this. 8.   And in case you hadn't noticed, Captain, we're twelve men short of what we were. (off the badly wounded  On foot? You got any idea how long that's gonna take? It'll be winter before we get there. That's the trouble with this part of the world. No mirrors. Niggers forget what color they are.  Glass said. Too bad I don't see him.  Or he's run off and left us.  My bet, that nigger's used to runnin'.  Wished he'da done it without firing his rifle. If there wasn't no `Ree around before, there will be now.  And riskin' gettin' us killed in the process. Glass won't know the difference no ways.  I signed on as a trapper, not a goddamn mule. description: While exploring uncharted wilderness in 1823, legendary frontiersman Hugh Glass sustains injuries from a brutal bear attack. When his hunting team leaves him for dead, Glass must utilize his survival skills to find a way back home while avoiding natives on their own hunt. Grief-stricken and fueled by vengeance, Glass treks through the wintry terrain to track down John Fitzgerald, the former confidant who betrayed and abandoned him.â€”Jwelch5742
